title: <article>
shortDescriptionOfTheTag: The <article> HTML element represents a self-contained composition in a document, page, application, or site, which is intended to be independently distributable or reusable (e.g., in syndication). Examples include: a forum post, a magazine or newspaper article, or a blog entry.

usageExamples.title: Basic usage of <article>
usageExamples.description: This example shows how to mark up a simple article, including a header with a title and publication date, and paragraphs of content.
usageExamples.code:
Article Title

Published on: January 27, 2023

This is a paragraph of content in the article...

Another paragraph of article content...
usageExamples.layoutsCode:
/article
	/header
		/h1
			Article Title
		/p
			Published on: 
			/time @datetime="2023-01-27"
				January 27, 2023
	/p
		This is a paragraph of content in the article...
	/p
		Another paragraph of article content...

usageExamples.title: Article with sections
usageExamples.description: The article element can also be used to enclose sections of content that should be treated as a single, independent item. This example includes multiple sections within the article.
usageExamples.code:
Main Article Title

Section 1 Title

Content of the first section...

Section 2 Title

Content of the second section...
usageExamples.layoutsCode:
/article
	/header
		/h1
			Main Article Title
	/section
		/h2
			Section 1 Title
		/p
			Content of the first section...
	/section
		/h2
			Section 2 Title
		/p
			Content of the second section...
